title: 115_hr6447
content: The Act is titled the "Department of Homeland Security Chief Data Officer Authorization Act." It establishes the Chief Data Officer position within the Department of Homeland Security. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a Chief Data Officer position within the Department of Homeland Security. The Chief Data Officer must have expertise in data management, governance, protection, analysis, and sharing, including personally identifiable information. Their responsibilities include ensuring departmental compliance with data regulations. The Chief Data Officer in the Department of Homeland Security is responsible for ensuring data management best practices, coordinating data integration for improved decision-making, reviewing data infrastructure impact, releasing data for public use after privacy reviews, promoting modern data systems, and coordinating data storage within the Department. The Chief Data Officer in the Department of Homeland Security oversees the storage of department records according to National Archives guidelines and ensures compliance with information quality standards. The Chief Data Officer in the Department of Homeland Security ensures compliance with information quality standards by coordinating with relevant components of the Department and reporting complaints to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The Department of Homeland Security appoints Chief Data Officers for each operational component to oversee data usage and compliance with standards. The Secretary shall coordinate with and assist the Chief Data Officer in implementing specified functions and submit reports to relevant committees on the implementation of this subsection. The House of Representatives passed the bill on September 4, 2018. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
